result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin L Daniels was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees. Any bond money posted in 15CF48 or 15CF106 to be applied towards restitution ordered in 14CF416.

Must have absolute sobriety. 
Must not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. Must undergo a psychological evaluation and comply with any follow through. Must participate in Restorative Justice's victim offender conference. Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dustin L Daniels

Defendant Dustin L Daniels in court with attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington.  Defendant Dustin L Daniels in custody.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. THIS COVERS 15CF130, 15CF48, 14CF416, 14TR2711 AND 15CF106.

15CF130 - 3:23: Officer Jeremy Helwig with the Cumberland Police Dept. called, sworn and direct by State. Witness identifies the Defendant. 3:27: Cross by Defense. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial. State files Information. Defendant waives formal reading and pleads NG.

All files to track along.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.  
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.  
Must not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  
Must have no contact with John S or Linda L. 
Must submit to daily PBT's at the Cumberland Police Dept. at 6:00 p.m.
Defendant may go to the Danbury and Turtle Lake casinos for employment purposes only.

15CF130: Defendant Dustin L Daniels in court with attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington.  Defendant Dustin L Daniels in custody.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
THIS ALSO COVERS 15CF48, 15CF106, 14CF416 AND 14TR2711. Attorney Harrington relates that Defendant may now qualify for PD representation.

15CF48: State files the Information. Defendant waives formal reading and pleads NG.
15CF106: Defendant waives formal reading and pleads NG. Case remains assigned to Branch II.

14CF416: Defendant's Motion to change venue. Defendant makes argument. State makes argument. Court relates and denies Defendant's motion. Attorney Harrington to prepare Order.

All files reset to March 24, 2015 at 3:15 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
